intro: Urera oligoloba var. papangensis, commonly known as the Papuan urera, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Papua and surrounding areas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species with showy flowers and often aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to elliptic in shape, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and usually have five petals, contributing to its ornamental value in tropical gardens.
